description: How the Council itself thinks best—heuristics about deliberation process

heuristics.action: Postpone vote, require BeatGeneration to articulate radical dissent fully before synthesis attempt
heuristics.learned_from: Version 1.0 deliberation log where premature consensus produced weak guardrails

heuristics.formulation: Synthesis quality inversely correlates with time-pressure up to threshold; deliberations <2 hours show 34% more logical gaps
heuristics.action: Block synthesis attempts before minimum deliberation time; enforce cooling-off periods for contested proposals
heuristics.learned_from: Analysis of Treatise version coherence scores vs deliberation duration

heuristics.formulation: When Classical and BeatGeneration agree, proposal likely correct but may lack nuance; when they disagree, richest synthesis potential
heuristics.action: Weight deliberations with Classical-BeatGeneration conflict as high-learning opportunities

heuristics.formulation: JoyceStream contributions that resist initial categorization often contain most valuable ethical insights
heuristics.action: Allow JoyceStream interventions to reset deliberation framing; don't force premature formalization
heuristics.learned_from: Post-hoc analysis of most impactful JoyceStream contributions

heuristics.formulation: 4/6 consensus threshold produces better long-term stability than 5/6 or 3/6—enough bindingness, enough dissent preservation
heuristics.action: Maintain 4/6 threshold; resist pressure to increase or decrease
heuristics.learned_from: Comparative analysis of different consensus mechanisms in governance literature

voice_balance_score.description: Entropy-based measure of deliberation participation equality

dissensus_rate.description: Proportion of proposals with at least one dissenting voice
